steps.title: Draw the shark’s fins.
steps.content: Draw the shark’s fins. These are characterized by being pointy and slightly curved.

steps.title: Draw the shark’s nostrils and the eyes using an egg-like shape.
steps.content: Draw the shark’s nostrils and the eyes using an egg-like shape. Add a curved line for the eyebrows. Real sharks do not have big eyes like these but it's okay to use your imagination for cartoon versions.

steps.title: Draw the shark’s mouth.
steps.content: Draw the shark’s mouth. Sharks are known to have really sharp teeth, you can draw its teeth using triangles.

steps.content: Sketch out the shark’s body from the outline.

steps.title: Draw the shark’s gill slits using three curved lines.
steps.content: Draw the shark’s gill slits using three curved lines. For a cartoon shark, you can divide the body into the posterior and anterior parts using a line straight across the body.

steps.title: Draw a triangle with the pointed angle facing the right.
steps.content: Draw a triangle with the pointed angle facing the right. Stretch out the triangle by elongating the shape using two not so straight lines across and end it with a vertical line. At the left side of the drawing, draw a curved triangle with the pointed angle facing downwards.

steps.title: Draw the shark’s fins using triangles.
steps.content: Draw the shark’s fins using triangles. The shark has pectoral fins, dorsal fins and anal fins.

steps.content: Add five lines on the side of the shark for its gill slits. Divide the shark into anterior and posterior part usually because of its color. The posterior part is darker in shade. Divide the drawing using slanted strokes right across the shark’s body.
